comments.body: is intent here to make `C` object in the true branch and string - in false one?

I believe so. Javascript doesn't work that way, of course, so that's why this PR makes it an error.

Note that since 2.0 it has worked this way. Previously, the false branch had no effect on the type of x.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@    //  - when false, has no effect on the type of x.
    
    if (typeof strOrC === "Object") {
        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2365: Operator '===' cannot be applied to types '"string" | "number" | "boolean" | "symbol" | "undefined" | "object" | "function"' and '"Object"'.
